intro: Aerva timorensis, commonly known as Timor grass, is a flowering plant native to the island of Timor. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Aerva timorensis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid or semi-arid conditions.
